page.title: 04Tetsworth C.P. School
page.content: When the population of Tetsworth was at its greatest the village supported several private and church schools. The only school today, a County Primary,was built in 1881 by the School Board. The building is an attractive Victorian design including a school house complete with bell tower. The older residents of the village recount how when they were in the school with ninety other children they sat in rows, behind desks attending to the teacher's Â£talk and chalk'. Today there are less than fifty children in the school. The emphasis has changed to meeting the needs of the individual and equipping them for tomorrow's world. As each generation moves towards the Secondary School they are encouraged to make some lasting contribution e.g. garden, playground markings to their Primary and truely village school.
